intro: Xuarezia biflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered panic grass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, two-flowered spikelets that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Xuarezia biflora is often used in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in local ecosystems.
